content.title: J.C. Bose Fellowship
content.details: The J.C. Bose Fellowship is meant to recognize active scientists for their outstanding performance. The fellowship is scientist-specific and very selective.
benefits: Research Grant of ₹15.00 Lakh per annum
₹1.00 Lakh provided as Overheads for the host institute
eligibility: Active scientist with a record of outstanding performance apparent from the award of SS Bhatnagar prize and/or fellowship of science academies
Scientist should be in service at the time of nomination
Nominee should be an Indian national working in institutions in India
content.application_process: Nominations for the J.C. Bose Fellowship are accepted throughout the year and there is no last date of acceptance of the nomination.
documents_required: Nominations from Heads of Institutions, JC Bose fellows, Presidents of Science Academies
NOCs from both the Institutes for changing host institute

faqs.question: What is the duration of the J.C. Bose Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The J.C. Bose Fellowship duration is 5 years.

faqs.question: Can the JC Bose fellow continue the fellowship after superannuation?
faqs.answer: The JC Bose fellowship can be continued after superannuation provided a host institution is willing to accept the fellowship and provide all necessary infrastructure and administrative support.

faqs.question: Is the personal fellowship received in J.C. Bose Fellowship scheme taxable?
Is there a provision for extension of the fellowship?
faqs.answer: The fellowship can be renewed for a period of 5 years after rigorous assessment of research performance of the fellow during the tenure of the fellowship.

faqs.question: How does a J.C. Bose Fellow get his subsequent Grant?
faqs.answer: The Grant for the subsequent years is released after receiving Statement of Expenditure (SE) and Utilization Certificate (UC) along with activity report through the online portal.
